poem:
The Original Slanket  

Noble Gary, in '98,  
wove a sleeved cocoon—  
a comfort cape for the sedentary.  
Yet Nicola, painter of fabric dreams,  
stitched her canvas early,  
her pénétrables inviting you in,  
art to enfold the curious,  
where blanket meets painting,  
where we slip inside the warmth  
of her imagination.
